attributes.action: Car tax exemption for cars over 30 years old
attributes.background: Classic cars between 30 and 40 years old have to be Taxed. There needs to be more of an incentive for owners to keep these cars going. Many cars of this age are in need of restoration, they are likely uneconomical to repair. This is the way forward to encourage the protection of classic cars

attributes.action: Stop foreign/indirect aid to India & China and redirect the money to the NHS.
attributes.background: Both India and China have active space exploration programs and 2 of the fastest growing economies in the world. Our NHS is in crisis which has recently been described as a humanitarian crisis. This money is desperately needed by our own National Health Service to save British lives.

attributes.action: Fine drunks to stop the abuse of the NHS and knock-on risk to lives!
attributes.background: Introduce legislation automatically fining drunks requiring NHS ambulance/medics, to stop their NHS abuse, by turning it into the National Hang-over Service.  Ambulances and medics attending drunks are services unavailable for genuine and so more worthy emergencies, with consequential risk to life.
attributes.additional_details: Police can impose a £100 fine for “Being drunk & disorderly”. Someone so drunk requiring NHS services is defacto “drunk & disorderly” and so should be automatically fined at least £100.  Ideally introduce a new charge of “Being drunk & disorderly to the extent of requiring NHS services” with a minimum fine of £500, increased annually by £500 until the problem has been eliminated – with all monies going direct to the NHS. 31 Dec. fines should be double to fund Emergency staff double time.

attributes.action: Ensure every school in the UK has Bullying awareness lessons for ages 5-16
attributes.background: Bullying effects many peoples lives, touches many family's & interrupts the personal and academic growth of every child. Personally as a child back in 1993 i was affected by bullying that still makes a impact on my adulthood today. I just don't see any improvement since then to protect our children
attributes.additional_details:
This petition suggests some of the following:

Every school is required by education policy through DfE to have group discussions setting out a plan on how to help pupils report bullying, its effects and challenges throughout academic growth.

Requests each school in UK to have Bullying awareness lessons ages 5-16 at least 3 times a year.

attributes.action: Make it law that cyclist's have to wear a high vis jacket.
attributes.background: Make it law that cyclist's have to wear a high vis jacket with reflective strips at all time when on the road and no headphones. To help them to be seen by motorists and they can hear what is happening on the road. This is after truck and car drivers are getting blamed for deaths of cyclists.

attributes.action: Mandatory vision and reaction check-up for all 75+ with a UK Driving license.
attributes.background: I have had personal experience of elderly drivers on wrong side of the road, being oblivious to cyclists, pulling out on roundabouts not noticing vehicles, stopping in main roads and causing serious collisions due to poor sight and reactions.
attributes.additional_details:
1 in 5 over 75 year olds in the UK are suffering with vision loss; and from research I have found there are approximately 4 Million drivers over the age of 70 on UK roads.

The current system in place allows the individual to self-assess and to alert the DVLA if they are not fit to drive. In many cases if the individual needs the car for transport they will be reluctant to inform of any changes in health, vision etc. Completing a fast assessment will eliminate any possibility of this.

attributes.action: Pass law to impound vehicles/caravans of travellers who damage public land.
attributes.background: Recently a travellers community has twice descended on our village, and twice been rapidly evicted by the local Council. The travellers, who act with a wholesome contempt for the law, have twice caused an indescribable and costly mess. This is a UK-wide problem. It's time to stop to this behaviour.
attributes.additional_details: If a group of travellers dumps vast quantities of bulk rubbish and human waste while they occupy public land, it costs tax payers' money to clean up. In these circumstances, the group's behaviour forfeits their right to live in this way. If they knew they could lose their vehicles/caravans, maybe they would behave differently. It's time to put a stop to this anti-social behaviour. Sign the petition and let's get our MPs to raise this issue in a Parliamentary debate!”

attributes.action: Government to make Child abuse a forefront issue & change laws for offenders!
attributes.background: I believe Child abuse especially sexual is not talked about enough when it is happening way too often. The goverment & the nation need to step up & work together to clamp down on catching & ending this inhumane crime. I would like it to be a forefront issue of the government & police & laws changed.
attributes.additional_details: Whether this is done by extra funding, volunteering or campaining. It is a responsibility of every normal human being especially parents who knows this is wrong. I would also like to see laws changed for sexual offenders to receive the death penalty as there is no place for their kind in this world & any child abusers to be sterilised from having anymore. This is not the type of world I want my children to live in & I believe it is all our duty for anyone who agrees with me.

attributes.action: Legalize CBD oil for medical use.
attributes.background: If it wasn't for CBD Oil I would still be in hospital. I've recently recovered from brain tumour surgery and CBD oil has helped me to bounce back without taking any of the pain meds given to me by doctors. CBD oil is giving me my life back slowly.
attributes.additional_details: I am setting up this petition to get CBD legalized for medical reasons, and I believe it should be given to people with many different health problems.

attributes.action: Repeal the European Communities Act, 1972
attributes.background: In enacting the European Communities Bill through an ordinary vote in the House of Commons, Ted Heath's Government breached the constitutional convention which requires a prior consultation of the people (either by a general election or a referendum) on any measure involving constitutional change.

attributes.action: Reduce the size of Motorcycle number plates
attributes.background: With HD cameras ANPR and better surveillance cameras the late 7 x 9 plate is not required and a more streamlined 6 x 4 plate would be adequate.  Motorcyclists can find the large plates cause drag and that also has a cost in respect of fuel usage. A smaller plate is more carbon efficient therefore.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for schools to teach basic BSL.
attributes.background: Communication  in children is very important. But what happens when the only way to communicate is by sign? Not being able to communicate and make friends can lower a child's self-esteem.Make it mandatory for schools to teach basic BSL in schools.

attributes.action: The UK parliament should close down this petition website.
attributes.background: The UK parliament should close down this petition website. It is being used by the vocal minority to pursue debates on niche issues that do not concern the British public as a whole.

attributes.action: Put a capping law on car insurance costs to help people get back to work.
attributes.background:
This year alone the price rise for the average car insurance is 14% and 20% in the northern regions according reports.

Although this is blamed on an increase in claims, I think we all know that the insurance company owners are rolling in it.

This is stopping our working economy.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.willistowerswatson.com/en-GB/press/2017/01/car-insurance-premiums-see-14-per-cent-annual-rise

https://www.theguardian.com/money/2016/nov/26/car-insurance-premium-rise-tax-hike-soaring-costs

https://www.confused.com/on-the-road/cost-of-motoring/what-the-price-index-means-for-you

attributes.action: Advise the Queen to make London Borough of Richmond a Royal Borough
attributes.background: Richmond has two existing Royal Palaces (Hampton Court & Kew Palace) and a rich history of Royal connections, patronage and places. No borough deserves Royal status more than Richmond.
attributes.additional_details: I wrote to the Secretary of State a few years ago asking for Royal Borough status for Richmond and it was politely declined in favour of Greenwich. Time to ask again via this petition.

attributes.action: Abolish Inheritance Tax.  It is wrong to tax assets that have already been taxed
attributes.background:
We believe that Inheritance Tax should be abolished. It is a tax on assets that have already been taxed. 
People should be free to leave their assets to whomsoever they want without fear of being taxed again. 
We believe that the Government should be bold enough to act and axe this iniquitous tax

attributes.action: Add gender-neutral name fields to the marriage certificate
attributes.background: This petition proposes that two gender-neutral name fields be added to  the marriage certificate, to replace the father-only field. This suggestion is to enable parity, irrespective of gender/sexual orientation.
attributes.additional_details: In answer to the previous petition that the mother's name be added to the marriage certificate, alongside the father's [https://www.change.org/p/mothers-names-should-be-on-marriage-certificates], the Home Office decided that it cannot agree to adding the mother's name, as that assumes couples have opposite-gender parents, and the idea is therefore exclusionary. Gender-neutral name fields is the obvious solution to this problem.

attributes.action: Allow GP's to be able to refer patients to out of area mental health services
attributes.background: With physical health you can request to be referred to a different hospital not in your borough through your GP. With mental health your GP can only refer you to the mental health services in your area. Patients should be able to request to go to specialised services through their GP for all health.
attributes.additional_details:
More patients are being referred back to their GP's and they can be the person who knows the patient best and need to have the option of sending the patient else where.

It could in certain situations help people get the help they need quicker if a GP can refer patients even if their service did refer them after being assessed onto somewhere that has wasted so much time and money that could've been saved if the GP and patient already knew where they needed to be referred to have the assessment.

attributes.action: Close hospitality establishments over the Christmas period.
attributes.background: Christmas is a family time, hospitality workers work extremely hard during the Christmas run up and many don't get Christmas day off, nevermind boxing day. Some things are needed over the festive period; eating out isn't one of them.
attributes.additional_details: As a chef, it is expected that I will work over the festive period, including Christmas day, boxing day and all bank holidays, with no extra incentive.   I fully support retail workers having Christmas day AND Boxing day off, but this should be extended to those who work in hospitality too. This is especially important for those who work away from their hometowns, as one day off is not long enough to get home to see their family and means a Christmas day spent alone.

attributes.action: Improve the social welfare safety net for people fleeing domestic abuse
attributes.background: Domestic abuse is a horrific situation for anyone to find themselves in & especially difficult for anyone who has to make decisions not just about their wellbeing but for children in their care. 2 women are killed weekly in the UK-if people feel they can leave safely this number may be reduced.
attributes.additional_details:
There is an alarming lack of support for people fleeing domestic abuse, especially women/families. This manifests the deprivation that families often experience moving out from an abuser or from a shelter.

"The threat of poverty is often described as being ‘among the most formidable'" barriers (NOWLDEF, 2002:1) from leaving toxic - in some cases deadly - situations with serious consequences. This hole in the social safety net is short-sighted in both its financial and societal implications.

attributes.action: Require Councillors to acknowledge conflict of interest
attributes.background: A recent series of developments in my city have been widely supported by a councilor, with suggested family ties to a prominent ties to a large property developer. If true this is a conflict of interests and should be acknowledged and prevented.

attributes.action: Stop the production of the 1 pence coins.
attributes.background:
The rate of inflation has made 1 pence coins virtually unusable. 
Canada has already removed its lowest value currency from circulation.
If the cost to produce one Canadian Penny is 1.5 Canadian Cents, then we can assume it has a similar cost in the UK.
It is uneconomical to keep in circulation.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.whatdotheyknow.com/request/cost_to_produce_one_penny

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-21292441

attributes.action: Stop UK Police from allowing officers to wear a burka
attributes.background: http://www.expressandstar.com/news/2016/09/09/west-midlands-police-officers-may-wear-burkas/

attributes.action: Open premises to homeless people when the temperature falls.
attributes.background: change the law, to require anyone who is responsible for a community centre or a sports hall to open their premises to homeless people when the temperature falls below a certain level.
attributes.additional_details: Just read a news story about a guy freezing to death on the coldest night of the year. It reached -9'c here. Its a simply request, which would help in cold weather, not a quick fix, but a start!

attributes.action: A constitution that forbids our Parliament ceding sovereignty to foreign powers.
attributes.background: This would prevent governments gradually ceding sovereignty to foreign powers as they have done for example over the last 44 years to the EU treaty by treaty.
attributes.additional_details:
Tony Benn on the Lisbon treaty & the EU > https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GTjg-vt0Ao4

'If parliament transfers sovereignty away in treaties such as Lisbon then it is stealing rights that don't belong to it because an MP is lent powers of the public for 5 years

But if in those 5 years you give it away to somebody else then you can't repeal those laws. This is a theft of public rights.'

attributes.action: Create legislation for public toilets to be available at all public open spaces
attributes.background: Due to government cuts to local authorities, Councils are currently closing down many essential public toilets, even at recreation grounds and parks. Areas that are open to the public for health & well being should have public toilet facilities provided and this needs to be law.
attributes.additional_details: A local recreation ground in Poole has 4, 11 a side football pitches. Just players alone would come close to 100 people which is not taking into account spectators. Because public toilets are not a legal requirement our local council has decided to save money by closing the public toilets. There are no other facilities available anywhere close. This is now becoming common throughout the country and it should be a legal requirement to ensure people can use and enjoy open spaces.

attributes.action: Give HM Forces the right to buy their MOD housing under the right to buy scheme
attributes.background: Allow serving personnel to buy their MOD married quaters under the right to buy scheme based on the current scheme used for local authority housing, this would allow soldiers to settle in areas their wages do not allow, would also reduce maintenance costs to the MOD.

attributes.action: Continuous blood glucose monitoring for Type 1 diabetics to be funded by NHS
attributes.background:
Insulin dependant diabetics have to fund their own continuos monitoring system.
It has been shown to improve HBA1c (blood sugars) dramatically and reduce diabetic side effects such as Amputation, Blindness and Kidney failure. It should be available to every one not just patients who can afford it!
attributes.additional_details:
It will save money over current methods ie finger prick blood glucose monitoring and reduce diabetic side effects and therefore huge costs to the NHS..

see British Diabetic Association etc

attributes.action: Provide funding for organisations to train psychological support dogs.
attributes.background: There is extensive research on the positive effects dogs and other animals have on the mental well-being of humans. Providing support dogs could help people with mental illness carry out activities otherwise limited by their mental illness. It could greatly help in cases of depression or anxiety.
attributes.additional_details: I can't even begin to reference the studies carried out on the effects animals have on human health and well-being as there is so much. Studies show that animals can reduce heart rates, blood pressure and cortisol levels (stress) of humans with their presence alone. Imagine what a support dog could do for someone who struggles to leave the house due to mental illness? Having a pet helps, but with pets you are limited on where you can take them. Support dogs could help in these situations.

attributes.action: Rethink healthcare provision on the Isle of Wight
attributes.background:
We reject the STP for Hampshire and the Isle of Wight. We demand that:
Comprehensive, high quality, place based systems of care be maintained at least at their present level on the Isle of Wight
GP and dentistry services are safeguarded
Resources for community mental health services are increased
attributes.additional_details: The current Government has created record NHS deficits – £2.45 billion and rising. 3.9 million people are on waiting lists for treatment. Last year, 1.8 million people had to wait 4 or more hours in A&E – a fourfold increase since 2010. A quarter of patients have been forced to wait a week or more just to see or speak to their GP or a nurse – some cannot even get an appointment. And now the Sustainability & Transformation Plan (STP) could mean Islanders losing 30% of NHS services.

attributes.action: Don't add the age verification and censoring of "non-conventional" on porn sites
attributes.background: Age verification checks on porn websites will be hard to implement. ISPs already offer many ways to do this without having to risk personal information. If age verification is done using credit card then dodgy websites may take advantage of this.
attributes.additional_details:
The government should not be allowed to decide what types of porn people are allowed to watch. As long as its consenting, over-18 adults, and it does not go against current law then it should be perfectly fine to show online.

Implementing age verification on to websites will be very risky if it uses personal information to check you are over-18. Lots of porn sites have been hacked recently so that is also a big concern. Parental controls can be easily setup so this is unneeded.

attributes.action: Make Stereotyping a compulsory subject in schools.
attributes.background: As part of a citizenship group. We believe Stereotyping is a significant topic that should be discussed as a school subject so that students can understand the causes and consequences of Stereotyping. We are a group of different ethnical and cultural backgrounds and have seen stereotyping.

attributes.action: Make putting an offer on a house purchase in England legally binding.
attributes.background: Far too many people are being let down and are also suffering unnecessary costs from the fact that people can put an offer on a house they want to buy and then withdraw at any point before exchange without penalty.
attributes.additional_details: Buying and selling houses is such a life changing and costly process it should not be subject to people changing their minds in a whim.  Many families can suffer heartache when a house chain collapses due to a person simply changing their mind.  I propose that before people enter a bid on a house they should get a survey and any searches competed and be in a position to pay a deposit.   This would add an a strong element of security to the house buying and selling process.

attributes.action: Reduce aid budget and fully fund an integrated health and social care service.
attributes.background: Our health and social care system is fragmented and in crisis.  The NHS is financially bankrupt and being kept afloat artificially.  The funding to UN Aid Budgets and other ill thought out financial aid initiatives should stop and that money diverted to the NHS and social care

attributes.action: Allow 16/17 year olds to vote.
attributes.background: In Year 9 in secondary school we are made to choose our GCSE subjects, at 16 we can smoke, win the lottery have sex, get a job. At 17 you can drive and you start choosing your University/life root and yet we cannot vote until we're 18. WE as a generation are one of the most educated ever. FIX IT.

attributes.action: change child benefit allowance to take into account full household income
attributes.background: To change the rate that child benifit has to be paid back. Currently two people in the same household can recieve 50k a year and claim child benifit, yet if one of the tax payers earns 60k and is the sole earner the whole child benifit needs to be paid back via tax.
attributes.additional_details:
Two people earning 50k a year on a basic tax code would take home £3039.00 each. Total of £6078, plus full child benifit of £1076.40 (one child) £1788.80 (two children). 
Total income for 2 children and salary =£7866.80

Yet if one member of the family is earning £60,000 which is the rate where child benifit is stopped, there total income for their family would be £3522. 

This needs to be looked at.

attributes.action: Suspend the 12 billion spent on overseas aid for cancer treatment and research.
attributes.background: One in two people are now affected by cancer. Since 2010 six of my relatives/ friends have died from cancer. Eight people I know currently have cancer, two with terminal cancer. A close relative is one of the two.
attributes.additional_details: The U.K. gives 12 billion pounds a year (0.7% GNI - source BBC - 2015) in overseas aid. I am not suggesting that this is stopped, only that as cancer is now so prevalent in our country ( one in two people are now affected - my husband's consultant quoted this) that temporarily this money is used to help the people in need in this country. Walk down the main corridor at The Christie (cancer specialist hospital) in Manchester at 9.00 am on any weekday to see how many people have this illness, and this is only one example of a hospital in the UK.

attributes.action: Fit seat belts on all public transport where there are seats provided.
attributes.background: Please would you consider fitting seat belts on all public transport where there are seats available, for the safety of the public. Cars, mini buses & cabs require this as law. Thank you.

attributes.action: Amend the1967 abortion act.No abortion after 24 weeks. Equality for all.
attributes.background:
In the UK it is legal to terminate a pregnancy up untill birth if the child has a disability such as Downs Syndrome. However it is illegal to terminate a child without a disability after 24 weeks.Help me to outlaw disability based abortions.No abortion after 24 weeks. 
#tellitrightstartitright
attributes.additional_details:
Lord Shinkwin’s Bill wants to outlaw abortions on the grounds of disability
If successful, the Abortion (Disability Equality) Bill will remove section 1(1)(d) from the 1967 Abortion Act, which allows for abortion on the grounds of disability up-to-birth. In the UK, disability-selective abortions are currently available right up to the moment of birth whereas in most cases, “healthy” babies cannot be aborted beyond 24 weeks.
#equalityforall
#tellitrightstartitright 
#SaveourDownsydromecommunity

attributes.action: Guarantee PIP for all people diagnosed with autism
attributes.background: If you are officially diagnosed with ASD/Autism by a GP or a health care professional such as a psychologist, psychiatrist or a multidisciplinary team, then a PIP assessment to prove your illness should not be needed. It should be recognised upon application when you provide written diagnosis.
attributes.additional_details: ASD/Autism is a life long condition and should automatically qualify for PIP. The assessment is nothing more than unnecessary bureaucracy that usually ends in refusal for PIP. I would also like to make the RT Hon Damian Green MP aware that the assessors that carry out these assessments do take advantage of an autistic person's disability to ensure they dont score any points in the assessment and refuse them PIP. If the RT Hon Damian Green would like more detail I am available to talk about it.

attributes.action: Change the redundancy law around workers who were full time & are now part time.
attributes.background: The law is very clear, It is defined as this "it is your part-time position which is being made redundant, you are therefore being compensated for your current part-time position." This is regardless of any previous full-time service, even if that is 10+ yrs of dedication over 2 yrs of part-time.
attributes.additional_details: In my opinion, those who are affected by this are those that have had a family or are a dedicated caregiver. With years of unwavering service to their company & returning part time, how is it justifiable not to consider that service at a time when it is most needed. What if  the job specification never changed, what if you are supporting a full-time role on part-time hours, which is the majority of cases. Redundancy is based on a calculation, a formula, that formula can be adapted.

attributes.action: Implement Mandatory Licensing For Estate Agents
attributes.background:
How can an industry that deals with the most valuable asset that their customers own, not be regulated by licensing as other industries are?

Complaints against estate agents are up 32% with a record £800,000 being paid out in compensation to home buyers, sellers and tenants (Oct 2016, TPOS).
attributes.additional_details: https://www.tpos.co.uk/news-media-and-press-releases/reports

attributes.action: UK govt to strongly condemn India for genocide of innocent Kashmiri muslims
attributes.background: Kashmiri muslims are asking for their right of freedom, which was conferred to them according to UN resolutions. They want Their right of plebiscite. Indian army is killing innocent and unarmed Kashmiri Muslims. Killings should be stopped immediately and Kashmiri should be invited for dialogue.

attributes.action: Bring back the Death Penalty for Murder, Rape and Child Molestation
attributes.background: With the growing murder and rape pandemic, it is necessary to have a deterrent.  Too long the government and judges have trivialised murder, rape and child molestation with poor sentences. The victims have been ignored by many judges and politicians are too quick back the criminals
attributes.additional_details: To qualify for the death sentence the nominal must be over the age of 18 and for the that person to have proven beyond all reasonable doubt to have committed the offence of murder, rape or child molestation.   The sentence should be the same regardless of ethnic background or gender and should be law that applies to all people in our country.  The victims are so twice. Firstly, by the perpetrator and and again by the judicial system with the weak sentences they give.  This has to stop.

attributes.action: A Royal Commission to review ALL aspects of  health & social care in the UK
attributes.background: Demand has outstripped capacity. Review inc: healthy lifestyles, aging population, mental health, health & social care in the community. Duty of care to all healthcare  professions.Attracting,training,retention of new professions. Increased funding

attributes.action: Urge the Iranian Government to free Nazanin Ratcliffe
attributes.background:
Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe,  was visiting family in Iran. She was  returning to the UK in April when she was detained by the Iranian  Guard. Now she is in solitary confinement and has no  lawyer
Gabriella is her 22 month old daughter.
Her British husband, and Red Cross have had no contact.

attributes.action: Parliament should ask the government to refuse to sell weapons to Turkey
attributes.background: The Prime Minister has recently announced the sale of £100 Million worth of fighter jets to Turkey, which has a declining record on human rights, democracy, and oppression/ bombing of its own people, many of whom are the most effective fighters against Terrorist groups such as ISIS/DEASH

attributes.action: Issue an apology regarding historical human rights abuse against the UK Romany
attributes.background: Ever since the early 1500's, the Romany population in the United Kingdom has been – through the varying Government legislation specifically aimed at “Egyptians” or “Gypsies” - severely and unfairly subjected to many human rights abuses that still cast a shadow on our community today ..
attributes.additional_details:
While expecting an outright apology may be wishful thinking, in the very least, we would like a Truth and Reconciliation Commission setup, to be tasked with discovering and revealing past wrongdoing by the UK Government in relation to the Romany, wrongdoing such as the vast array of Government legislation that made it a capital punishment to even be a Romany Gypsy.

The past shapes the future ... #Respect4Roma

attributes.action: Allow life Imprisonment for cat killers
attributes.background:
People are not scared to kill cats or other animals, as is shown with the Croydon cat killer, he has slaughtered hundreds of cats. However, the maximum sentence for killing a cat is 6 months imprisonment. 
This will not deter awful criminals from ending a poor cat's life.
attributes.additional_details:
More details
http://www.express.co.uk/news/nature/664265/Croydon-cat-killer-jailed-weeks-campaigners-call-for-tougher-sentencing-animal-cruelty 
Animal abusers are locked up for just weeks before coming out and killing again.

attributes.action: Extend sentencing powers to allow the use of lifetime bans from driving.
attributes.background: Many motorists obey the law till they get behind a steering wheel. They don't ever think of going to jail but would relate more to the possibility of being banned from driving for life. Such bans would be at the judge's discretion and only used for repeated bad driving or the most heinous incidents.
attributes.additional_details:
The kinds of cases I am thinking about include repeated use of mobile phones and repeated cases of drink- or drug-driving resulting in injury/death, or killing/injuring someone while driving at more than 20 per cent over a speed limit. 

While a long jail sentence is not always good for society, a short sentence and lifetime ban would emphasise the seriousness of an offence and give victims/relatives a stronger impression that justice had been done. Jail would be an option for breaches of a ban.
